                                                                              Code de l’examen
ENGLISH B – STANDARD LEVEL – PAPER 1                                         Código del examen
ANGLAIS B – NIVEAU MOYEN – ÉPREUVE 1
INGLÉS B – NIVEL MEDIO – PRUEBA 1                               2      2     1     4    –    2     2     2     8

Tuesday 6 May 2014 (afternoon)                                    Candidate session number
Mardi 6 mai 2014 (après-midi)                                   Numéro de session du candidat
Martes 6 de mayo de 2014 (tarde)                              Número de convocatoria del alumno

1 h 30 m


QUESTION AND ANSWER BOOKLET – INSTRUCTIONS TO CANDIDATES
• Write your session number in the boxes above.
• Do not open this booklet until instructed to do so.
• This booklet contains all the paper 1 questions.
• Refer to the text booklet which accompanies this booklet.
• Answer all of the questions in the boxes provided. Each question is allocated [1 mark] unless otherwise
  stated.
• The maximum mark for this examination paper is [45 marks].

LIVRET DE QUESTIONS ET RÉPONSES – INSTRUCTIONS DESTINÉES AUX CANDIDATS
• Écrivez votre numéro de session dans les cases ci-dessus.
• N’ouvrez pas ce livret avant d’y être autorisé(e).
• Ce livret contient toutes les questions de l’épreuve 1.
• Référez-vous au livret de textes qui accompagne ce livret.
• Répondez à toutes les questions dans les cases prévues à cet effet. Sauf indication contraire, chaque
  question vaut [1 point].
• Le nombre maximum de points pour cette épreuve d’examen est [45 points].

CUADERNO DE PREGUNTAS Y RESPUESTAS – INSTRUCCIONES PARA LOS ALUMNOS
• Escriba su número de convocatoria en las casillas de arriba.
• No abra este cuaderno hasta que se lo autoricen.
• Este cuaderno contiene todas las preguntas de la prueba 1.
• Consulte el cuaderno de textos que acompaña a este cuaderno.
• Conteste todas las preguntas en las casillas provistas. Cada pregunta vale [1 punto] salvo que se indique
  lo contrario.
• La puntuación máxima para esta prueba de examen es [45 puntos].

                                     12EP01
                                                                             –2–                         M14/2/ABENG/SP1/ENG/TZ0/XX/Q

TEXT A — MONITORING VOLUNTEERS NEEDED!

Match the first part of the sentence with the appropriate ending on the right. Write the appropriate letter
in the boxes provided.


Example: The Research Team aims to …                                    D             A.        cause the peat to decay.
                                                                                      B.        help check the water levels.
1.   Volunteers are needed to …                                                       C.        organize the peat and moorland.
                                                                                      D.        find willing volunteers.
2.   Without peat bogs, too much
     water can …                                                                      E.        fund the monitoring programme.
                                                                                      F.        threaten the land below.
3.   The monitoring programme also                                                    G.        control the amount of water.
     aims to …
                                                                                      H.        offer learning opportunities to volunteers.



Answer the following questions.

4.   How many days a week will a volunteer work?


      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




5.   Why does a volunteer have to be fit?


      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




6.   What two essentials does a volunteer need to have?                                                                                               [2 marks]


      (a)      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 

      (b)      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




                                                         12EP02
                                                                            –3–                         M14/2/ABENG/SP1/ENG/TZ0/XX/Q

7.   Why can volunteers not use their mobile phones?


     . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




8.   Name the one thing for which volunteers will be refunded.


     . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




Choose the correct answer from A, B, C or D. Write the letter in the box provided.

9.   The main purpose of the text is to …

     A.       explain the purpose of conservation.
     B.       attract people to volunteer.
     C.       teach new skills to volunteers.
     D.       discuss the importance of conservation.

TEXT B — VIDEO CONFERENCING AND LEARNING

Find the word in the right-hand column that could meaningfully replace one of the words on the left.


Example: surprise (line 3)                    C             A.        intermingle
                                                            B.        worldwide
10.   interact (line 7)                                     C.        astonish
                                                            D.        deepen
11.   global (line 8)
                                                            E.        command
12.   power (line 9)                                        F.        startle
                                                            G.        communicate
13.   enrich (line 10)
                                                            H.        persistence
                                                            I.        enhance
14.   endless (line 12)
                                                            J.        infinite
                                                            K.        whole
                                                            L.        strength



Answer the following questions.

15.   Which phrase between lines 9 and 15 means “a mixture of technology and classroom teaching”?


      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




16.   With whom does the school in Alice Springs have a connection?


      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




                                                         12EP04
                                                                             –5–                         M14/2/ABENG/SP1/ENG/TZ0/XX/Q

17.   Why is video conferencing an advantage for isolated schools?


      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




18.   To whom or to what does the word “they” refer in line 21?


      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




Choose the correct answer from A, B, C or D. Write the letter in the box provided.

19.   According to the text, video conferencing will help students to be able to …

      A.       learn without teachers.
      B.       resolve global issues.
      C.       increase their learning.
      D.       learn without classrooms.

TEXT C — ZAMBIAN ARTISTS USE A RHINO STATUE TO RAISE AWARENESS

Answer the following questions.

20.   What material is the inside of the rhino made of?


      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




21.   Why did Alexsis and Almakyo use a form of art?


      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




22.   Which phrase between lines 10 and 16 means “making the Zambian people aware”?


      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




23.   Give one of the dangers that Zambian rhinos face.


      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




                                                         12EP06
                                                                             –7–                         M14/2/ABENG/SP1/ENG/TZ0/XX/Q

Match the questions with the paragraphs in the text. Write the appropriate letter in the boxes provided.


Example: [ – X – ]               C             A.        Are plastics endangering the rhinos?
                                               B.        When were rhinos first in Zambia?
24.   [ – 24 – ]                               C.        What do you hope to achieve?
                                               D.        Are the authorities working to save the wildlife?
25.   [ – 25 – ]
                                               E.        Is there a reason why you’ve made this rhino now?
26.   [ – 26 – ]                               F.        Will our children and tourists see the rhinos?
                                               G.        And what message is this to be?
27.   [ – 27 – ]
                                               H.        Tell me more about Zambia’s rhinos.
                                               I.        What is the public doing to African wild animals?
                                               J.        Why did you use plastic waste?



Find the words in the text which mean the following (lines 10–21).

Example: assist

       . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . help . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 

28.   continually


      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




29.   crucial


      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




30.   inheritance


      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

                                                         12EP07
                                                     –8–            M14/2/ABENG/SP1/ENG/TZ0/XX/Q

31.   From statements A to H, select the three that are true according to text C. Write the appropriate
      letters in the boxes provided.                                                         [3 marks]

      A.   Plastic is now a matter of great concern for Zambia.                      Example:     A
      B.   Children throw their rubbish into the Kachere Art Studio.
      C.   Local people donate their litter to the artists.
      D.   All Zambians are unaware of how much plastic rubbish there is.
      E.   Every kind of rubbish is useful to the artists.
      F.   Art is a method of utilizing plastic waste.
      G.   Local residents are received particularly warmly at Kachere Art Studio.
      H.   The two artists have a clear idea of what they want to do.



Choose the correct answer from A, B, C or D. Write the letter in the box provided.

32.   By referring to plastic as the “unofficial national flower” (line 28), Alexis means that
      plastic is …

      A.   admired by all.
      B.   becoming a symbol of Zambia.
      C.   growing all over Zambia.
      D.   seen as unimportant.




                                       12EP08
                                                                         –9–                       M14/2/ABENG/SP1/ENG/TZ0/XX/Q

TEXT D — WHY BILINGUALS ARE SMARTER

The sentences below are either true or false. Tick [] the correct response then justify it with a relevant
brief quotation from the text. Both a tick [] and a quotation are required for one mark.

                                                                                                                                     True         False
Example: It is clear that being bilingual is useful.                                                                                   

      Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . obvious practical benefits. . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .


33.       Speaking two languages makes a person more intelligent.

          Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .




34.       Bilingual people are better than monolinguals at working out any kind of
          intellectual problem.

          Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .




35.       It is easier to concentrate when you speak two languages.

          Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .




36.       Bilinguals’ brains are more active when keeping track of changes.

          Justification: . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .




                                                                                      Turn over / Tournez la page / Véase al dorso
                                                      12EP09
                                                                            – 10 –                       M14/2/ABENG/SP1/ENG/TZ0/XX/Q

Answer the following questions.

37.   To whom or to what does the word “others” (line 28) refer?


      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . 




38.   Give one of the ways being bilingual benefits your health.


      . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .

Which words go in the gaps between lines 31 and 33? Choose the words from the list and write them in
the boxes below.

                       deep                   nobody                  speak                    suspicion               we

                       doubt                  some                    strange                  talk                    who



Example: [ – X – ] . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .  nobody . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . . .
